Class Automaton.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • Automaton.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    Automaton

    public static class Automaton.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    Builds an automaton.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Builder() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAcceptState(java.lang.String name)
      Adds a state with the given name as an accept state to the automaton.
      void addTransition(java.lang.String sourceName, java.lang.String destinationName, java.lang.String symbol)
      Adds a transition between the given states on the given symbol.
      Automaton getResult()
      Returns the automaton built by this builder and blocks any further building.
      void setStartState(java.lang.String name)
      Makes a state with the given name the start state of the automaton.

        public Builder()

    • Method Detail

      • addAcceptState

        public void addAcceptState(java.lang.String name)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                           java.lang.NullPointerException
        Adds a state with the given name as an accept state to the automaton.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the accept state
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the result of this builder has already been successfully requested
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if name is a null pointer

      • addTransition

        public void addTransition(java.lang.String sourceName,
                          java.lang.String destinationName,
                          java.lang.String symbol)
                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Adds a transition between the given states on the given symbol.
        Parameters:
        sourceName - the state from which the transition departs
        destinationName - the state in which the transition arrives
        symbol - the symbol allowing the transition, or a null pointer to transition without any symbol
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if sourceName or destinationName is a null pointer

      • getResult

        public Automaton getResult()
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns the automaton built by this builder and blocks any further building.
        Returns:
        the automaton built by this builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the automaton has no start state yet

      • setStartState

        public void setStartState(java.lang.String name)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                          java.lang.NullPointerException
        Makes a state with the given name the start state of the automaton.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the start state
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the result of this builder has already been successfully requested
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if name is a null pointer
